result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond Massie Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 8 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.  Obtain GED or HSED.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent. Do not go into any bars.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with recovery program. Report to Racine Vocational Ministry once released. Be involved in mental health counseling. Do not associate with any known gang members. No contact with K.M.J.   Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond Massie Jr

  Plea hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Raymond Massie in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke. Defendant Raymond Massie in custody. Antoinette Rich for W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Will be ready to proceed with trial.
Def- Requesting another status date before the trial.
BTC: Any jury instructions or Motions in Limine to be filed by February 26th. 
  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). KMJ.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 11/19/2015 Placed on house arrest. Must live at the home of his mother. His mother or another adult must be present at all times. May only leave home for court appearances or meetings with his attorney. May not use social media. May only use a cell phone to contact his mother.

Defendant Raymond Massie in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke. Defendant Raymond Massie in custody. Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Request the bond be modified to $5,000 cash and placed on GPS monitoring with house arrest.
St- Objects to any modification of the bond.
BTC: Bond modified to $20,000 cash and placed on house arrest. Must live at the home of his mother and either his mother or another adult must be present at all times. May only leave home for court appearances or meetings with his attorney. May not use social media. May only use a cell phone to contact his mother. Motions to be filed by 1-26.
ATTY Rosenke files petition for bond modification.

Bail/bond hearing at 11-19-2015 02:30 pm.
Status conference at 01-26-2016 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 03-08-2016 01:30 pm.
